title: ICE on Linux when procfs is missing

labels.name: A-driver
labels.description: Area: rustc_driver that ties everything together into the `rustc` compiler

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

body:
```
thread 'main' panicked at 'failed to get current_exe: no /proc/self/exe available. Is /proc mounted?', src/librustc/session/filesearch.rs:167:23
stack backtrace:
   0: rust_metadata_std_1b2bf47eb61dd8d63d9fdc0ba6857f57
   1: rust_metadata_std_1b2bf47eb61dd8d63d9fdc0ba6857f57
   2: rust_metadata_std_1b2bf47eb61dd8d63d9fdc0ba6857f57
   3: rust_metadata_std_1b2bf47eb61dd8d63d9fdc0ba6857f57
   4: std::panicking::rust_panic_with_hook
   5: <unknown>
   6: rustc::session::filesearch::get_or_default_sysroot
   7: <unknown>
   8: rustc_driver::version
   9: rustc_driver::handle_options
  10: rustc_driver::run_compiler
  11: <unknown>
  12: __rust_maybe_catch_panic
  13: <unknown>
  14: rustc_driver::main
  15: <unknown>
  16: rust_metadata_std_1b2bf47eb61dd8d63d9fdc0ba6857f57
  17: __rust_maybe_catch_panic
  18: std::rt::lang_start_internal
  19: <unknown>
  20: __libc_start_main
  21: <unknown>

error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic
```
P.S. I used fresh (not more than 2 days old) nightly toolchain
